abstract.para: The setroubleshoot tool offers user-friendly methods for analyzing and debugging issues caused by &selnx; denials.

section.title: What is setroubleshoot?
setroubleshoot components
section.para: The &selnx; troubleshooting process involves the following components, all of which are installed on &productnameshort; by default.

listitem.para: setroubleshootd—the main daemon handling incoming requests and plug-in definitions. The daemon is activated on demand and does not require running via the &systemd; service. It can be managed only by a privileged user and a dedicated setroubleshoot user.
a database of alerts in the file /var/lib/setroubleshoot/setroubleshoot_database.xml
sealert—a command-line user interface to analyze the /var/log/audit.log
sedispatch—an audit dispatcher that scans &selnx; AVC messages and transforms them into a DBus message, then passed to the daemon.
setroubleshoot-plugins—the plug-ins are used for AVC message analysis and provide suggestions on how to fix problems.

section.title: How does setroubleshoot work?
section.para: setroubleshoot comprises a daemon and analysis plug-ins. When a plug-in detects a problem, it is reported to the daemon, which then checks whether this is a known problem. If not, the new problem is added to the database along with a suggested solution.

section.title: Benefits of setroubleshoot
section.para: setroubleshoot provides the following functionalities to help you solve problems on your &selnx; secured systems:

listitem.para: Sending alerts to the administrator when there is an AVC denial.
Suggesting possible fixes, such as adjusting system configuration or installing updates and so on.
